neatsim.core

Interface BlackBox

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FastCyclicNetwork

    public interface BlackBox
    Interface to a black box. Black boxes have a number of inputs and a number of outputs. Outputs are calculated from the current but also possibly previous inputs (i.e. black boxes may contain state). Black boxes should be used as follows.
    • Set inputs using setInput(int, double).
    • Call activate().
    • Read outputs using getOutput(int).
    As mentioned before, some black boxes may have state. Calling reset() sets the state of the black box to the value it has upon initialisation.
    Author:
    Jonathan Merlevede
    Invariants:
  • The number of inputs is positive
        getNumberOfInputs() >= 0
  • The number of outputs is positive
        getNumberOfOutputs() >= 0
